title: Subgoal-Label-Based Microlearning for Strengthening Programming Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic programming syntax and algorithmic concepts
context.additional_context: Customized training course for current professionals, designed around mobile device utilization and formative assessment

learning_goals: Learners can analyze task examples with subgoal labels to decompose complex programming problems with 80% accuracy.
Learners can generate subgoal labels independently for provided practice problems and effectively explain the problem-solving process three or more times.
Considering the transfer distance between task examples and practice problems, learners can apply an average of two or more optimization techniques in algorithm design.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
